revised_title: Percussion-Induced Magnetical Properties in Steel and Iron: Part II
tldr: The author, William Scoresby, conducted experiments to determine the development of magnetic properties in steel and iron through percussion. He found that using a combination of auxiliary iron rods could produce higher degrees of magnetic energy. The compound process, which involved placing steel wires between two rods of iron, resulted in better outcomes than the simple process. The author also observed that the quality, size, and temper of steel wires affected the success of the experiment.
